title: Apple QuickTime Packed-bit Decoding Heap Overflow Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code on vulnerable installations of Apple QuickTime. User interaction is required to exploit this vulnerability in that the target must visit a malicious page or open a malicious file.
The specific flaw exists when the application parses a malformed .PSD image. While decoding the columns, rows and channels in the image header, the application trusts a different length for copying than used for allocating it. This results in a heap overflow and can lead to code execution under the context of the current user.
addtionnal_details: Apple has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:http://support.apple.com/kb/HT3591
timeline:
2009-04-15 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2009-06-02 - Coordinated public release of advisory
